topic.question: 1. The student who arrived yesterday walks very rapidly. How does he walk?
2. Bob and Bill are getting together for lunch. What will Bob do?
3. John is a safe driver.
4. This hat fits me alright. I'll take it.
5. John considers his work a pleasure.
6. Mrs. Jones saw a light in a distance.
option: She saw a light far away.
She saw a light next door.
She saw a light in the hall.

topic.question: 7. She took off her coat.
8. The instructor broke his microphone.
option: He could not see his notes.
He could not lift the box.
He could not broadcast his voice.

topic.question: 9. The movie will begin at three o'clock.
option: It will be over at 3 o'clock.

topic.question: 10. When we went on the picnic, we participated in many games.
11. Thad is feeling pretty good. How does he feel?
12. Each of the boys has a separate room. What does each boy have?
13. The cable was concealed in back of engine. Where was the cable hidden?
option: on the left side of the engine

topic.question: 14. Joe will be gone for an extended period of time. How long will he be gone?
option: for a short period of time
for a long period of time

topic.question: 15. Where is a person's neck?
option: between his foot and his leg
between his hand and his arm
between his legs and his back
between his shoulders and his head.

topic.question: 16. This student works independently of others. How does he work?
17. How far do you have to go to get to work?
option: I go to work by car.
I ride to work with Bill.

topic.question: 18. Lt. Lee sent his sister a letter.
option: His sister gave him a letter.

topic.question:
19. The instructor wrote the instructions on the blackboard. The students wrote them in their
notebooks. What did the students write in their notebooks?
20. His name immediately came into my mind.
option: I did not know his name.
I remembered what he looked like.

topic.question: 21. The second part of the plan is essential.
22. The cat must stay out.
23. We ran into a lot of traffic at the airport.
option: We did not see any traffic.

topic.question: 24. Mr. Smith has to go to the bank today.
25. Bill wealth is broke. What's his problem?
26. John saw a friend in town last night. What did John see?
27. The instructor was illustrating the new method. What was he doing?
option: He was finding fault with it.
He was reading and writing about it.
He was explaining it with pictures.

topic.question: 28. Jim doesn't like to eat alone in a restaurant.
29. The instructor said, "I can hardly hear you." What did the instructor mean?
option: You are not speaking loudly enough.

topic.question: 30. As soon as we arrived, the rain began to fall. When did it start raining?
31. Would you like to revise this paper?
option: Yes, I would like to correct it.
Yes, I would like to destroy it.
Yes, I like the size of the paper.
Yes, I bought the paper to use here.

topic.question: 32. The clock is attached to the wall. Where is the clock?
33. Joe wants to glance at the materials in the store. What does he want to do?
option: have a quick look at the materials

topic.question: 34. Major Marcum guided the discussion. What did he do?
option: He spoke more than anyone else.
He kept people outside the room.

topic.question: 35. Did you intend to do that?
option: Yes, it was a lucky accident.
Yes, I found out about it later.
Yes, it was a surprise to me.

topic.question: 36. The weather is worse today.
option: The weather isn't so good today.

topic.question: 37. Since the time of World War One, incredible progress has been made in the development and production of this weapon.
option: No progress has been made since World War I.

topic.question: 38. I was talking to John when Paul cut in.
39. The instructor wrote a problem on the chalkboard and asked a student to work it out.
option: The instructor asked the student to present a problem.
The student was asked to solve the problem.
The student asked the instructor to take the problem out.
The instructor wanted the problem to remain unsolved.

topic.question: 40. He put the money in a slot. Where did he put it?
41. The student found out about the trip yesterday. What happened yesterday?
option: The student learned about the trip.
The student forgot about the trip.
The student was worried about the trip.
The student didn't think about the trip.

topic.question: 42. The store put a number of things on sale. What did they do?
43. Virginia's husband has an excellent position with the government.
option: He is in good physical condition.

topic.question: 44. Dave told us to bring the sports equipment. What did Dave tell us to bring?
45. Harvey and May met accidentally
option: They had to go to a meeting.

topic.question: 46. George is going sailing. What is he going to do?
option: He is going for a boat ride.
He is going to sell a boat.
He is going to a sale.
He is going to look at some cars.

topic.question: 47. After a while, Judy realized the mistake.
48. I am looking forward to meeting him.
option: I am eager to meet him.

topic.question: 49. How long does it take to go from San Antonia to Chicago?
option: by bus, car, train, or plane
It's a long distance between them.
about a day and a half by car

topic.question: 50. The soldier worked in transportation and supply. What did his job involve?
51. It began to drizzle soon after we landed.
52. Someone walked away with our new book. What happened to the book?

53. Beatrice found many unusual shells.
She was walking _________.
54. Jane is burning the midnight oil. What is she doing?
option: She's coming home early every night.
She's studying until late every night.
She's watching television late at night.
She's going to bed early every night.

topic.question:
55. John is careful and hard working.
He is _________.
56. Mr. Kirk has a great deal of influence at this school. What can Mr. Kirk do?
option: ensure that his ideas are used

topic.question:
57. W: What did you buy?
M: Some clothes.
Q: What did the man buy?

58. M: What are you going to do this afternoon?
W: I am going to a movie.
Q: What is the woman going to do?

59. W: I am sorry, sir, but you can't go in.
M: But I have an official pass.
Q: Why this man thinks he should be allowed to enter?
option: He has permission from someone in authority.
He thinks his reason for entering is very important.

topic.question:
60. W: Jack, will you please switch on the light?
M: Certainly, Mary, I'll be glad to.
Q: What will Jack do?
option: He will turn the light on.
He will change the light bulb.
He will install a new switch on the light

topic.question:
61. W: Did you begin in November?
M: Yes, and I finished in one month.
Q: When did the man finish?

62. W: What would you like to eat?
M: Anything will be all right.
Q: What did the man say?
option: He doesn't care what he eats.
He wants very little to eat.

topic.question:
63. M: What are the children doing?
W: They are listening to a story.
Q: What are the children listening to?

64. W: Claude seems very proud of his latest painting.
M: Yes, he has it on display in the art gallery.
Q: What is Claude doing with his painting?

65. W: Where should we meet tomorrow? I think this corner would be good.
M: I was going to say the post office. But now I think we'd better meet right here.
Q: Where will the man and the woman probably meet?

66. W: What are you waiting for?
M: She forgot to bring me a fork.
Q: What is he getting ready to do?
